Class dom.beans.BeanDObject 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----dom.session.DObject
           |
           +----dom.beans.DBean
                   |
                   +----dom.beans.BeanDObject
public class BeanDObject
extends DBean
A DObject subclass that provides a wrapper for a DistributedBean instance (some object that implements the DistributedBean interface).

Author:
Scott Lewis

myBeanBoxView 
 BeanBoxView myBeanBoxView

BeanDObject 
 public BeanDObject(View aView,
                    DObjectID myID,
                    SessionViewID homeID,
                    URL codebase,
                    Serializable param) throws InstantiationException
Public constructor for this DObject. This is called for both the host and client instance.

Parameters:
session - a View object that defines our local runtime context. If this parameter is null, an InstantiationException is thrown.
newID - a DObjectID that is the new id for this DObject. If this parameter is null, an InstantiationException is thrown.
homeID - a SessionViewID that is the home view id for this DObject If this parameter is null, an InstantiationException is thrown.
codeBase - an URL that identifies the (local or remote) codebase for this DObject. This parameter may be null.
params - an Object that is used to initialize any subclasses
Throws: InstantiationException
is thrown if any of the critical parameters are null.

activated 
 protected void activated(ViewNotifyInfo info)
This is called by our run queue thread in response to a message from the View

Parameters:
info - the ViewNotifyInfo associated provided by the View when it notifies us we have been activated.
Overrides:
activated in class DBean
deactivated 
 protected void deactivated(ViewNotifyInfo info)
This is called by our run queue thread in response to a message from the View. In response to this message, we should do any clean up that we would like to have done before we go away as this is the last message we will get from the View.

Parameters:
info - the ViewNotifyInfo associated provided by the View when it notifies us we have been deactivated.
Overrides:
deactivated in class DBean
getStateForClient 
 protected Serializable getStateForClient(SessionViewID id)
Get the state of this DObject for client creation. In this case, our state is simply the serialized state of the JavaBean we are a wrapper for, so we simply return our JavaBean. This assumes that the Bean we are a wrapper for implements the Serializable interface (which should be the case anyway by construction).

Parameters:
id - the SessionViewID of the View where we are doing the creation
Returns:
Serializable that will be our remote client's initial state
Overrides:
getStateForClient in class DBean
